Package com.guardsquare.dexguard.runtime.net

Class SSLPinningSystemWebViewClient

java.lang.Object
android.webkit.WebViewClient
org.apache.cordova.engine.SystemWebViewClient
com.guardsquare.dexguard.runtime.net.SSLPinningSystemWebViewClient
public class SSLPinningSystemWebViewClient extends org.apache.cordova.engine.SystemWebViewClient
This SystemWebViewClient pins SSL connections to given certificates hashes. The implementation reroutes https requests to check the SSL certificates against a predefined list of accepted certificates.

This approach has some drawbacks which have to be taken into account:

  • Slower as all requests get serialized and rerouted over an HttpsUrlConnection.
  • Requests can not be fully duplicated sometimes because of missing data, for example HTTP headers and method,... (only applicable if Android level < 21)
  • The WebView is still under the impression it loaded the initial URL, this could cause base_url issues and have strange effects on relative paths in the webpage.

    • shouldInterceptRequest

      public android.webkit.WebResourceResponse shouldInterceptRequest(android.webkit.WebView view, android.webkit.WebResourceRequest request)
      We intercept https requests and leave the others for the SystemWebViewClient to process. This overrides the API 21+ 'shouldInterceptRequest' method.

      Note: this method should not be called from client code.
